recipes.process: Grate cheddar cheese and add with cornstarch into a small bowl. Combine with milk in a medium saucepan and cook on medium to low heat until consistent. Keep warm until serving. In a separate pan boil ramen noodles. Set aside the included flavor packets. Once boiling, drain the noodles and combine with cheese.
recipes.name: Ram n’ Cheese

recipes.process: Cook the pasta according to the box and drain, but reserve ½ cup of the cooking water. Cook mushrooms and onion in olive oil for 2 to 3 minutes in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the wine, salt and pepper and cook for 5 to 6 minutes. Toss the pasta with the Brie and cooking water and add mushroom mixture and arugula.
recipes.name: Mushroom Pasta

recipes.process: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add the macaroni and cook until al dente. Strain the pasta, setting aside about 1 cup of the pasta water in a bowl for additional steps later on. In a saucepan, combine up the half and half, oregano and crushed red pepper and place over heat to a simmer. Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring often. Add the cream cheese and stir until there are no chunks in the mixture. Mix in the shredded Cheddar and Gruyere cheese until sauce is smooth. Add the macaroni and the previously set aside cup of water to the saucepan. Don’t worry if it looks too liquidy; eventually the macaroni will soak up the excess liquid. Stir in the marinara sauce, sun dried tomatoes and pepperoni. Once thoroughly mixed, pour into a 13″x9″ inch pan. Evenly sprinkle breadcrumbs and Parmesan over the baking pan with the macaroni and sauce in it. Stick it in the oven for about 10 minutes to lightly brown the macaroni and allow the breadcrumbs to get crispy. Take out of the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Serve it up and grub ’til that food coma ensues.
recipes.name: Pizza MnC

recipes.process: Place chicken breast in Crock-Pot. Pour remaining ingredients over chicken. Set Crock-Pot on “low” and cook for 7 hours. Remove chicken breasts from Crock-Pot. Shred chicken breast with two forks.  The chicken will be extremely tender, so this will be easy! Return chicken to Crock-Pot and cook for one more hour. Keep Crock-Pot on “warm” until you’re ready to eat.
recipes.name: Chicken Chili

recipes.process:
1. Preheat oven to 400ºF and spray a muffin pan with cooking oil.

2. Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. 3. In a separate bowl, combine milk, butter, eggs and vanilla.

 4. Add wet mixture to dry mixture and fold batter until combined.

 5. Place a spoonful of batter in each muffin cup, then a slightly smaller spoonful of Nutella on top and cover with the rest of the batter.

 6. Bake for 15 minutes.

 7. When cool, mix cinnamon and sugar together, dip muffin tops in butter and coat in cinnamon sugar before serving.
recipes.name: Doughnut Muffins

recipes.process:
1. Slice zucchini and squash into half-circles and cut cherry tomatoes in half.

2. Sauté zucchini and squash in olive oil until soft, then add cherry tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper.

 3. Beat eggs in a separate small bowl and add into pan once tomatoes are wilted. Stir ingredients together in pan.

 4. Once eggs are almost set, add cheese and salsa and stir until eggs are just cooked. (Caution: Don’t overcook eggs!)

 5. Spoon into tortilla, add avocado and wrap. Sorry, what’s meat again?
recipes.name: Breakfast Burrito

recipes.process:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F.
2. Slice avocado in half.
3. Scoop out pit to create hole for the egg.
4. Place avocado in a small baking cup. Line with tinfoil for minimal clean-up.
5. Crack the egg into the hole.
6. Bake for 15-20 minutes.
7. Season with salt and pepper, or seasoning of your choice. If you have them, sprinkle chopped scallions on top.
recipes.name: Baked Egg

recipes.process:
1. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp, cumin and garlic; sauté 3 minutes or until shrimp are pink.
2. Combine cooked shrimp, sour cream and green onions in a large bowl.
3. Spread tortilla chips on an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet. Top with shrimp mixture and sprinkle with cheese.
4. Broil 5 to 6 minutes from heat 2 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve immediately.
recipes.name: Shrimp Nachos

recipes.process:
1. Using a microwave-safe bowl, add in the oats, milk and chia seeds.
2. Microwave on regular for 3-4 minutes (3 minutes gives you a chewier oats; whichever you prefer).
3. Add flaxseed meal, a little extra milk if you prefer, honey, cinnamon, nut butter and whatever toppings you want. Enjoy!
recipes.name: Oatmeal
